intro: Argomuellera lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved argomuellera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
